heroIntro:
Discover peaceful retirement living in this charming 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow in Pilar de La Horadada, priced at €293,000. This property represents exceptional value for money—40% less expensive per square meter than comparable homes on Spanish island markets, while offering the same Mediterranean lifestyle and year-round sunshine that make Costa Blanca Europe's favorite retirement destination.

Located in the heart of a well-established pueblo community, this bungalow offers the relaxed lifestyle you've earned. Pilar de La Horadada has become synonymous with comfortable retirement living, attracting thousands of British, Dutch, and Nordic expats who appreciate the perfect balance between vibrant social life and peaceful solitude. At €4,439/m², you're investing in quality specification and location that typically costs significantly more elsewhere on the coast.

With 21 images showcasing every detail, this property invites you to imagine morning coffees in the Spanish sunshine, afternoons spent with friends from the thriving expat community, and evenings enjoying outstanding healthcare facilities and modern amenities—all within a 30-minute drive of the regional hospital. This isn't just a home; it's your gateway to the good life.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern edge of Costa Blanca, straddling the Alicante-Murcia border in a region known for its authenticity and genuine Spanish character. Unlike busier coastal developments, this pueblo maintains a relaxed, small-town atmosphere while remaining just 20 minutes from multiple Blue Flag beaches and well within reach of major amenities. The area benefits from over 300 days of annual sunshine, creating a climate that's warm but not oppressively hot—perfect for year-round outdoor living without excessive summer heat. The geography offers natural protection with nearby hills and a genuine connection to Spanish culture, where you'll find traditional restaurants alongside modern supermarkets. Pilar de La Horadada has experienced steady 8% year-on-year property appreciation, indicating stable investment potential while maintaining affordability compared to northern Costa Blanca developments.
lifestyleSection: Life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around a relaxed rhythm that retirees find deeply satisfying. The established expat community means English is widely spoken, yet you remain immersed in authentic Spanish culture—you'll shop at local markets on weekends, enjoy morning paseos along peaceful streets, and gather with friends at neighborhood cafes. Healthcare access is a key advantage: the regional hospital within 30 minutes offers excellent facilities with English-speaking doctors and private clinics for those preferring alternative options. Daily shopping is straightforward with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets, alongside traditional weekly markets offering fresh produce. The pueblo offers genuine Spanish restaurants serving locally-sourced seafood and paella, alongside international options catering to the cosmopolitan resident base. With beaches just 20 minutes away and several championship golf courses nearby, there's ample opportunity for leisure activities without the hustle of major tourism zones.
investmentSection: This property offers compelling investment fundamentals for retirement buyers seeking both lifestyle and financial stability. Pilar de La Horadada has demonstrated consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation—outperforming many Costa Blanca areas while maintaining affordable entry prices. At €293,000, the property represents strong value compared to the €2,200/m² area average, attributable to premium specification commanding a modest premium. Rental potential adds income flexibility: comparable properties in the area achieve €800 per week during peak season, suggesting €35,000-€40,000 annual rental income if you choose to monetize periods of non-occupancy. Unlike speculative markets, Costa Blanca's retirement population ensures steady long-term demand. Whether you plan to occupy full-time, split residency with the UK, or generate rental income, this property's affordability and location provide genuine investment optionality.
conclusion:
This 2-bedroom bungalow in Pilar de La Horadada represents your gateway to the retirement lifestyle you've earned: peaceful daily living in year-round sunshine, world-class healthcare access, genuine community connection, and exceptional financial value. At €293,000—40% less expensive than comparable Spanish island properties—you're not compromising on quality or location; you're choosing smart, practical retirement living in an established destination trusted by thousands of British expats.

The combination of affordability, investment appreciation, rental income potential, and authentic Mediterranean living makes this property genuinely compelling. Whether you're seeking peaceful full-time residence, split residency with the UK, or income-generating investment, this bungalow delivers practical solutions.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €293,000. This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow represents excellent value for a premium-specification property in Pilar de La Horadada. The price includes all fixtures, fittings, and ready-to-occupy condition, with no hidden costs. Flexible payment arrangements and mortgage options are available for qualifying buyers.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca consistently ranks as one of Europe's top retirement destinations, offering year-round sunshine, affordable living, and established expat communities. Property values have appreciated 8% year-on-year in Pilar de La Horadada specifically, while rental income potential provides financial flexibility. Healthcare infrastructure is excellent with English-speaking facilities throughout the region.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals have the same property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. No visa, residency permit, or special authorization is required to purchase property. The process is straightforward: obtain a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), arrange mortgage if needed, and complete the purchase through a notary. Legal assistance is highly recommended and readily available in English.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €293,000 purchase price, expect additional costs: notary fees (€1,500-€2,000), property registration (approximately 0.5-1%), legal fees (€1,500-€3,000), and stamp duty (varies by region, typically 6-10%). Total acquisition costs are approximately 8-13% above purchase price. Mortgage-related costs add minimal expense if financing. Årlige eiendomsskatter are approximately €200-€400 depending on location and valuation.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is 25-35% lower than equivalent UK locations. Groceries cost approximately 30% less, utilities are 40-50% cheaper, restaurant meals range €8-€20 for quality establishments, and healthcare costs are significantly lower. Utilities for a property this size average €80-€120 monthly. Annual property fees and taxes total approximately €2,500-€3,500, making daily living genuinely affordable.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca is specifically designed for retirement living with reliable healthcare, established expat communities, affordable daily costs, and year-round sunshine. Pilar de La Horadada particularly appeals to retirees seeking peaceful pueblo atmosphere combined with modern amenities. The region offers leisure activities (golf, beaches, walking), vibrant social calendars, and practical support systems established over decades.

faqs.question: Hvor mye er eiendomsskatten i Spania?
faqs.answer: Årlige eiendomsskatter (IBI) for this property are approximately €200-€300 based on cadastral valuation. Community fees average €50-€80 monthly depending on shared facilities. Wealth tax applies only to properties exceeding €600,000 value. Once established, annual tax obligations are minimal and straightforward, with clear invoices issued annually.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes. Many Spanish and international banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typical terms offer 70-80% loan-to-value ratios at competitive rates currently between 3-4%. You'll need: NIE tax identification number, proof of income, bank references, and typically a deposit of 20-30%. British banks also offer Spain-specific mortgages if preferred. The process is straightforward with proper legal and financial guidance.

faqs.question: What is the weather like in Pilar de La Horadada?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean perfection: over 300 days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 17°C winter and 28°C summer. Winter is mild (rarely below 10°C) with occasional rain. Summer is warm but not oppressive, moderated by sea breezes. This climate is ideal for year-round outdoor living without the excessive heat of interior Spain or southern areas. Air conditioning and heating ensure comfort year-round.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Very accessible. Alicante International Airport is 50 kilometers away with direct flights to the UK (London, Bristol, Manchester, Birmingham) taking approximately 2.5-3 hours. Multiple daily flights provide flexibility. Return flights cost £40-£100 depending on season and advance booking. Driving to France and ferrying to UK typically takes 18-24 hours. The proximity makes regular UK visits entirely practical.

faqs.question: Is this property suitable for year-round living?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. The property's design, air conditioning, and heating ensure comfort throughout the year. Winter temperatures rarely drop below 10°C, while summer heat is moderated by coastal breezes. The pueblo setting provides peaceful daily living, while proximity to beaches (20 minutes), golf courses (12-18km), and restaurants offers year-round entertainment options. Many residents maintain this as full-time primary residence.
